Dear Ms. Burhans:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced facility completed on
October 21, 2021. Due to the violations, a written corrective action plan is required. It
should be noted that violations of any licensing statutes rules and are also violations of
the MISEP and your contract. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of
this letter and must include the following:
 How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
licensing statute and rule or section of the contract or MISEP citation.
 Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, a regular license will be issued. If
you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action will result.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (616) 204-6992.
Sincerely,

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes except for the
following:
R 400.155 Institutions not detention institutions or shelter care
institutions; initial treatment plan.
(1) The social service worker shall complete, sign, and date an
initial treatment plan for each resident within 30 calendar days
of admission.
One of three files reviewed pre-dated the initial treatment plan. Consultant was on-
site at the facility on 10/21/2021, initial treatment plan was dated 10/22/2021.
R 400.4108 Financing and audit.
A licensee shall do all of the following:
(a) Obtain an annual audit of all financial accounts. Audits for
nongovernmental institutions shall be conducted by an
independent certified public accountant who is not
administratively related to the agency.
The facility did not have a completed audit of the financial accounts.
R 400.4113 Employee records.
An institution shall maintain employee records for each
employee and shall include documentation of all of the following
information prior to employment or at the time specified in this
rule:
(j) A written evaluation of the employee's performance within
30 days of the completion of the probationary period or within
180 days, whichever is less, and a written evaluation of the
employee’s performance annually thereafter.
One of eight files reviewed had a performance evaluation completed late.
This is a repeat noncompliance from the renewal evaluation completed
11/14/2019.
R 400.4120 Supervisor of direct care workers; qualifications.
A supervisor of direct care workers shall have 1 of the following:
(c) A high school diploma and 4 years of work experience in
a child caring institution.
One of eight files reviewed lacked documentation that the supervisor had four years
of experience working in a child caring institution.
R 400.4152 Initial documentation.
At the time of admission, all of the following shall be in the
resident's case record:
4

(c) A brief description of the resident's preparation for
placement and general physical and emotional state at the time
of admission.
Two of three files reviewed lacked information pertaining to the youth’s preparation
for placement.
R 400.4156 Institutions not detention institutions or shelter care
institutions; updated treatment plan.
(1) The social service worker shall complete, sign, and date
an updated treatment plan for each resident at least once
every 90-calendar days following the initial treatment plan.
One of three files reviewed pre-dated the updated treatment plan by four days.
Consultant was on-site at the facility on 10/21/2021, updated treatment plan was
dated 10/25/2021.
R 400.4166 Discharge plan.
(1) When a resident is discharged from institutional care, all of
the following information shall be documented in the case
record within 14 days after discharge:
(a) The date of and reason for discharge, and the new
location of the child.
(b) A brief summary or other documentation of the services
provided while in residence, including medical and dental
services.
(c) An assessment of the resident’s needs that remain to be
met.
(d) Any services that will be provided by the facility after
discharge.
(e) A statement that the discharge plan recommendations,
including medical and dental follow up that is needed, have
been reviewed with the resident and with the parent and with
the responsible case manager.
(f) The name and official title of the person to whom the
resident was discharged.
One of two files reviewed did not have a completed discharge plan.
This is a repeat noncompliance from the interim evaluation completed
01/15/2021.
2.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also an MISEP violation. Please note that there are
additional MISEP requirements that may not be included in section 1. The facility is in
compliance with all additional MISEP requirements.

V. CONSULTATION
The facility did not request consultation.

VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
During the period under review there have been six special investigations. Three
special investigations found the facility in full compliance. Three investigations found
the facility in non-compliance. As a result, the facility has submitted three acceptable
corrective action plans not related to maltreatment during this licensing period. The
non-compliances were for not maintaining line-of-sight, not having a chief
administrator, not notifying DCWL of a youth’s contact with law enforcement, and for
a staff pushing a youth. During quarterly unannounced visits and a corrective action
plan compliance review, the agency has successfully implemented all aspects of their
corrective action plans.
During the onsite visit, a walkthrough of the facility occurred. Medications were
locked and stored securely. A meal menu was posted, and ample food was present
in the facility. Staff and youth were interviewed and reported feeling supported, safe
and regular treatment was occurring.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules and/or MISEP requirements and/or contract/policy. Upon
receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it is recommended that the facility be
issued a renewal of their regular license.
